node.title: Taxi Explodes Outside Liverpool Hospital, Killing One
node.alt: The police in Liverpool, England, responded to reports on Sunday that a taxi had pulled up outside the Womenâ€™s Hospital and exploded, the authorities said.
node.description: The cause of the explosion, which injured a second person, was not immediately clear. The investigation was being led by Counter Terrorism Policing North West with support from the local police.
node.content: ["A taxi exploded outside a hospital in Liverpool, England, on Sunday morning, killing one person and injuring another, the authorities said.", "The cause of the explosion was not immediately clear. Counter Terrorism Policing North West, part of a national alliance of police forces, said it was leading the investigation with support from the Merseyside Police in Liverpool.", "At about 11 a.m. local time, the police responded to reports that a taxi had pulled up outside the Women\u2019s Hospital in Liverpool and exploded, the Merseyside Police said in a statement.", "\u201cWork is still ongoing to establish what has happened and could take some time before we\u2019re in a position to confirm anything,\u201d Chief Constable Serena Kennedy of the Merseyside Police told reporters on Sunday.", "Ms. Kennedy said the authorities were \u201ckeeping an open mind\u201d as they investigated.", "Given the circumstances of how the explosion occurred, she added, Britain\u2019s Counter Terrorism Policing would lead the investigation. Britain\u2019s home secretary, Priti Patel, said on Twitter that she was receiving regular updates \u201con the awful incident at Liverpool Women\u2019s Hospital.\u201d", "Information about the person who was killed in the explosion was not immediately available.", "A second victim, a man, was hospitalized with injuries that the authorities said were not life-threatening. Phil Garrigan, the chief fire officer of the Merseyside Fire and Rescue Service, told reporters on Sunday that the man \u201chad left the vehicle prior to the fire developing to the extent that it did.\u201d", "The fire from the explosion was extinguished quickly, Chief Garrigan said.", "Access to the hospital, the authorities said, would be restricted \u201cuntil further notice,\u201d and some patients were diverted to other hospitals. Ambulances were still being allowed access to the hospital for emergencies, and staff members were being escorted into and out of the building by the authorities.", "The mayor of Liverpool, Joanne Anderson, said in a statement that \u201cthe incident at the Liverpool Women\u2019s Hospital is unsettling and upsetting and my thoughts are with those affected.\u201d"]
